author: Robbie Savage
title: 'Sack Claudio Ranieri? Leicester City should erect a statue of him' - Robbie Savage responds to YOUR tweets
text:
Claudio Ranieri's high-flying Foxes have come to earth with a thud (Photo: PA Wire) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Robbie Savage sounded a dire warning to Leicester fans that the champions were ticking virtually none of the boxes that made them 5,000-1 title winners 12 months ago. 
And Foxes fans rose impeccably to the bait, responding en masse to the Mirror Sport pundit's comments about where it has gone so wrong for Claudio Ranieri's side this season. 
Here, in Sav Says, he answers a selection of his online fan mail... Read More Should Leicester City sack boss Claudio Ranieri? Hear former Foxes star Robbie Savage hit out at haters Leicester's Demarai Gray and Shinji Okazaki show their disappointment after their loss to Swansea (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Paul Bates (#MUFC) @Paul_Bates_: Think Leicester City need to get #GaryLineker out of retirement. In fact even @RobbieSavage8 would be an improvement 
SAV SAYS: “Steady on, Paul – Gary Lineker is a Leicester legend, and I won the League Cup with them in my playing career, but our time has come and gone. We've both got jobs in the media now. It's awfully kind of you to suggest that I might be able to help them out when the chips are down, but I'm 42 now, you know...” 
Lee Marlow @LM_Marlow: Dear @RobbieSavage8, You are not one of us, You ceased to be one of us when you kissed the badge of our rivals, stop pretending you are. Gary Lineker is a Foxes legend, but it's a bit late for him to save their season (Photo: Getty) 
SAV SAYS: “You're boring me, Lee. If you don't know how much I loved playing for Leicester, and how much I admired Martin O'Neill as a manager, you don't know me at all.” 
Richard Booker @booko67: @RobbieSavage8 has to be the least liked ex-LCFC player. I can't actually think of another ex-player I don't like. 
SAV SAYS: “That's fine, Richard. You're entitled to your opinion every bit as much as I'm entitled to mine. You may not like me now, but there must have been a few Leicester fans who did – or they wouldn't have voted me player of the season, would they?” Some Leicester fans might not love Savage, but plenty do (Photo: Birmingham Post and Mail) 
Daithi O'Laohgaire @Cunionsandphey: Champions to a relegation dogfight. @RobbieSavage8 nails it on what's gone awry. 
SAV SAYS: “Unfortunately, nothing about Leicester's performance in the 2-0 defeat at Swansea suggested anything has changed. That display at the Liberty didn't tick the boxes I was talking about in terms of energy, passion, spirit and attitude. It was just more of the same. I still believe they might – just might – have enough experience and quality to hang on in the Premier League, but it's going to be desperately tight.” (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
M Curtis @markleecurtis: Players gotta play, Kante is good but one player, Vardy can't score without the ball 
SAV SAYS: “I agree – it's time for the players to stand up and be counted. As I observed in my column last week, N'Golo Kante has been a huge miss as the minesweeper who protects the back four. He was so good last season that he made Robert Huth and Wes Morgan look like Franco Baresi and Paolo Maldini at times, and he also gave Danny Drinkwater a platform to shine in midfield. I do have some sympathy with Jamie Vardy – his body language has not always been great, but in terms of service, he has been feeding on scraps. It's absolutely incredible that, seven weeks into 2017, Leicester still have not scored in the Premier League this calendar year.” Ranieri and captain Wes Morgan pose on behalf of Leicester with their Laureus Spirit of Sport Award (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
David Cann @drwhofan_194: There's no patience in football any more – not even for a man who performed a miracle. Unbelievable. 
SAV SAYS: “No arguments from me. They should erect a statue of Claudio Ranieri in the centre of Leicester, to stand alongside King Richard III, in recognition of what he's done for the city. I could not believe it when a fellow pundit on Radio 5 Live, Chris Sutton, suggested that Ranieri would lose his job if Leicester had finished 12th last season and they had gone on the same run of results now. But that's the whole point – they didn't finish 12th last year, they won the title! He gave Leicester City the most magical moment in their history. It was the most extraordinary football story ever told. And if you go back over the last nine years, out of 92 places in the top four divisions, in order they have finished 42nd, 45th, 25th, 30th, 29th, 23rd, 21st, 14th and 1st. Where is the precedent that says they are fighting to become champions of England every year? In my opinion, if Leicester go down, Ranieri should be given the chance to bring them back up.” Sav says Leicester should put a statue of Ranieri next to King Richard III (Photo: Getty Images) 
Steven Terrett @StevenTerrett: #motd Leicester v Derby. Is that Donald J Trump or Robbie Savage? 
SAV SAYS: “Haha - like me, Mr Trump has also risen to a position of considerable prominence!” 
And finally... 
Ollie Wedgbury @ollie_wedgbury: Why the **** is Dion Dublin presenting Homes Under the Hammer? What's next – Robbie Savage presenting Antiques Roadshow 
SAV SAYS: “I would have thought I was better suited to hosting David Dickinson's Real Deal – after all, my permatanned look is a good match for him!” poll loading Is Claudio Ranieri's job as Leicester boss under threat? 0+ VOTES SO FAR If they are relegated, definitely No way, he's untouchable after last season Like us on Facebook
